title: The Book of Kells
description: Illuminated manuscript containing the four Gospels of the New Testament, decorated with intricate and colorful illustrations.

title: The Bayeux Tapestry
description: Embroidered cloth depicting the events leading up to the Norman conquest of England, including the Battle of Hastings.

title: Chartres Cathedral
description: Gothic cathedral located in Chartres, France, renowned for its stained glass windows and architectural grandeur.

title: The Lindisfarne Gospels
description: Illuminated manuscript containing the Gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John, lavishly illustrated with intricate designs and patterns.

title: The Unicorn Tapestries
description: A series of woven tapestries depicting various scenes featuring unicorns, animals, and hunters, representing the medieval concept of chivalry and symbolism.

title: The Book of Hours of Jeanne d'Evreux
description: Lavishly illuminated manuscript prayer book commissioned by Queen Jeanne d'Evreux, featuring exquisite miniatures and decorative motifs.

title: The Hours of Catherine of Cleves
description: Illuminated manuscript book of hours owned by Catherine of Cleves, featuring intricate illustrations and miniatures depicting religious scenes and daily activities.

title: The Doors of Ghiberti
description: A pair of bronze doors for the Florence Baptistery, adorned with intricately sculpted biblical scenes and figures, showcasing the early Renaissance style.

title: The Westminster Retable
description: Painted altarpiece featuring scenes from the life of Christ, located in Westminster Abbey, London.

title: The Stavelot Triptych
description: Portable triptych made of wood and metal, featuring engraved biblical scenes and figures, possibly used for private devotion.

title: Mona Lisa
description: A renowned portrait of Lisa Gherardini, known as Mona Lisa, featuring a captivating smile and meticulous details.

title: The Last Supper
description: A mural painting depicting the final meal of Jesus with his disciples, known for its composition and perspective.

title: The Birth of Venus
description: A mythological painting depicting the birth of the goddess Venus, known for its graceful composition and ethereal beauty.

title: The Creation of Adam
description: A fresco painting on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel depicting the biblical creation of Adam, renowned for its iconic composition.

title: The School of Athens
description: A fresco painting depicting a gathering of ancient Greek philosophers, representing the pursuit of knowledge and philosophy.

title: The Creation of Eve
description: A panel painting on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel depicting the creation of Eve from the biblical story of Adam and Eve.

title: The Sistine Madonna
description: A religious painting depicting the Virgin Mary, with the Christ Child and saints, known for its soft colors and emotional impact.

title: The Last Judgment
description: A massive fresco painting on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel depicting the second coming of Christ and the final judgment.

title: The David
description: A marble sculpture depicting the biblical hero David, known for its exceptional detail and representation of human anatomy.

title: Primavera
description: A large-scale mythological painting depicting a group of mythological figures in a springtime garden, symbolizing the arrival of spring and the rebirth of nature.

title: The Calling of St. Matthew
description: A dramatic painting depicting the biblical scene of Jesus calling St. Matthew to become one of his disciples.

title: The Ecstasy of St. Teresa
description: A sculptural group representing the mystical experience of St. Teresa of Avila, depicting her in a state of spiritual ecstasy.

title: The Night Watch
description: A famous group portrait of a city militia, known as the "Night Watch," showcasing Rembrandt's mastery of light, shadow, and characterization.

title: The Conversion of St. Paul
description: A powerful painting depicting the moment of St. Paul's conversion on the road to Damascus, with intense light and dramatic realism.

title: The Raising of the Cross
description: A monumental altarpiece depicting the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, displaying Rubens' dynamic composition and use of color.

title: The Coronation of the Virgin
description: A painting depicting the coronation of the Virgin Mary in heaven, showcasing Velázquez's mastery of light and shadow.

title: The Allegory of the Faith
description: A symbolic painting representing the virtue of faith, featuring a female figure holding a chalice and a Bible.

title: The Triumph of Bacchus
description: A lively and festive painting depicting the Roman god Bacchus (Dionysus) surrounded by revelers and wine.

title: The Sacrifice of Isaac
description: A dramatic painting illustrating the biblical story of Abraham's willingness to sacrifice his son Isaac, showcasing Caravaggio's use of chiaroscuro.

title: The Anatomy Lesson of Dr. Nicolaes Tulp
description: A group portrait depicting Dr. Nicolaes Tulp demonstrating a dissection to fellow surgeons, highlighting Rembrandt's mastery of portraiture and lighting effects.

title: The Death of Marat
description: A powerful and iconic painting depicting the murdered French revolutionary leader Jean-Paul Marat in his bathtub.

title: Oath of the Horatii
description: A monumental painting depicting a scene from Roman history, showcasing the oath-taking ceremony of the Horatii brothers.

title: The Sleep of Reason Produces Monsters
description: An etching from Goya's series of prints titled "Los Caprichos," depicting a man asleep at his desk surrounded by ominous creatures.

title: Napoleon Crossing the Alps
description: A grandiose painting portraying Napoleon Bonaparte on horseback crossing the Alps, symbolizing his military prowess.

title: The Third of May 1808
description: A monumental painting depicting the execution of Spanish civilians during the Peninsular War, showcasing Goya's anti-war sentiment.

title: Cupid and Psyche
description: A marble sculpture depicting the mythological lovers Cupid and Psyche in an embracing pose, showcasing Canova's mastery of sculptural drapery and anatomy.

title: The Raft of the Medusa
description: A monumental painting depicting the tragic aftermath of the shipwreck of the French naval frigate Medusa, showcasing the struggles and despair of the survivors.

title: The Emperor Napoleon in His Study at the Tuileries
description: A portrait of Napoleon Bonaparte in his study, capturing the emperor's intense gaze and reflective mood.

title: The Coronation of Napoleon
description: A monumental painting depicting the coronation of Napoleon Bonaparte and Empress Josephine in Notre-Dame Cathedral, Paris.

title: The Hay Wain
description: A landscape painting depicting a hay wain (cart) by a river, showcasing Constable's meticulous attention to detail and his love for the English countryside.
